definition: to push aside (clothing, curtain etc) to reveal something/to toss aside
to lift up (sth hanging down)/to raise (hem of skirt)/to pull up (sleeve)/to sprinkle (water with cupped hands)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: She pushed heavy yellow hair away from her face.
sentences.chinese: 她撩開披在臉上的濃黃頭髮。

sentences.english: Turn the lights down low, take it off, let me show.
sentences.chinese: 調暗燈光，撩開面紗，我爲你秀。

sentences.english: I uncover the red kerchief on your head.
He was swinging the two long and skinny legs and treading the muddy water with a clattering sound.
sentences.chinese: 他撩開兩條瘦長的腿，撲踏撲踏地踩着泥水走着。

sentences.english: My sister lifts her head to get a gulp of air, pushing her mess of brown curls out of the way.
sentences.chinese: 我妹妹擡起頭吸一大口氣，撩開她亂糟糟的褐色捲髮。

sentences.english: He went out through the bead curtain.
sentences.chinese: 他撩開珠簾子走了出來。

sentences.english: My sister lifts her head to get a gulp of air, pushing her mess of brown curls out of the way. Her eyes focus on the window—no, on me.
sentences.chinese: 我妹妹擡起頭吸一大口氣，撩開她亂糟糟的褐色捲髮。

sentences.english: She pushed heavy yellow hair away from her face .
sentences.chinese: 她撩開披在臉上的濃黃頭髮。
